topic.title: HPE Helion 1.2 Development Platform: Growing and Renaming Clusters Using Horizon

ph.i: Windows, .NET, SQL Server, and IIS are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and/or other countries.

body.p: Follow these instructions to use the Horizon console to grow your clusters by adding more DEA nodes or services. These instructions are intended for installations of the Helion Development Platform running on Helion OpenStack!registeredtrademarksymbol! version 1.1.1 or later.
Note that Windows DEA nodes and SQL Server services will not appear in the Horizon interface until you upload the appropriate images into Glance.

After creating a cluster, go to the Clusters page. [Project tab > expand Application Lifecycle Service > Clusters] Click on the Actions down arrow to display the options and select the desired option.

section.title: To add DEAs
section.p: Click on Grow DEAs, fill out the details, and then click Grow. This will create the specified number of DEAs of the selected type and attach them to the cluster.

section.title: To add more services
section.p: Check the check box to select the services and then click Grow Services. This will create the selected service nodes and attach them to the cluster.
Click Rename Cluster, enter the new name, and then click Rename. Note that this renames the cluster title, but does not affect the cluster prefix.
